intro: Rostellularia adscendens var. juncea, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rostellularia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, opposite leaves that are often lance-shaped. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, clustered in inflorescences, and are pollinated by insects. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
